title: Insert Cult Line image and add Three.js ASCIIText 'KARM' section above Social Proof

requirements.text: Add a new Three.js-based ASCII text React component (ported from the provided codepen-based snippet) and render it with the text "KARM" (enableWaves=false, asciiFontSize=7) in a new full-width section placed above the section that contains the line "Used during real study sessions" (i.e., above SocialProofSection in the landing page flow).

quotes: add the image im giving you now and also im giving a code for ASCII text make that similar one but with the text KARM
you put this above the section where we have written used during real study sessions

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page order renders the ASCIIText section before the Social Proof section (before the lines that include "Used during real study sessions").
ASCIIText renders the word "KARM" (not the default text) and respects props: enableWaves={false} and asciiFontSize={7}.
The ASCIIText component cleans up WebGL/DOM resources on unmount (no runaway requestAnimationFrame; event listeners removed).
The section is responsive: it has a stable height on mobile/desktop and does not overflow horizontally.

requirements.text: Insert the user-provided uploaded image into the "Built for people who are done negotiating with themselves." (CultLineSection) area, positioned above that line, and style it to fit the existing dark landing aesthetic (centered, responsive, with appropriate max-width and spacing).

quotes: above that line, built for people who are done negotiating with themselves add the image im giving you now

acceptanceCriteria: The image is displayed above the CultLineSection heading text ("Built for people who are done negotiating with themselves.").
The image is served as a static frontend asset (not via backend) and loads correctly in production build.
The image is responsive (keeps aspect ratio, has sensible max width, and does not cause layout shift beyond normal image loading).

requirements.text: Ensure the Cult Line heading copy uses the exact sentence case and punctuation: "Built for people who are done negotiating with themselves." and keep all user-facing text in English.

quotes: built for people who are done negotiating with themselves

acceptanceCriteria: The displayed heading text matches exactly: "Built for people who are done negotiating with themselves."
No new non-English user-facing strings are introduced as part of this change.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Backend must remain single-actor in backend/main.mo; no new backend services.
Do not route or proxy images through the backend; images must be static frontend assets.
nonGoals: Do not change APK download URL behavior or CTA logic.
Do not add new authentication flows or backend persistence.
Do not refactor existing hero FaultyTerminal implementation beyond what is necessary to place the new ASCIIText section.

required: Cropped/cleaned version of the uploaded screenshot focusing on the central card (karm-whatsapp-card.dim_736x1472.jpg)
